data.title: Nice to have a neighborhood restaurant in Bloomington
data.text: I really enjoyed the bread and the Luna di Luna Special.  This is a quaint little restaurant with limited seating so probably a good idea to make reservations.  The service was very good and it's nice to have a family owned & operated establishment that serves really good Italian food.  Looking forward to my return visit to try other menu items.

data.title: Very Charming Restaurant
data.text: We ate here for dinner while staying in Bloomington.  It is a small restaurant so either go early like we did or make a reservation.  The owner seated us with a big smile and pleasant greeting.  We both had pasta, one with all seafood and one with chicken and shrimp.  Both dishes were excellent.  They bring you homemade bread with dipping sauce.  Very fresh and tasty.  We also both received a salad with a wonderful dressing (lots of garlic).  It was an excellent meal in a charming restaurant and one we will go back to.  As one reviewer mentioned it does not look like much from the outside but do not let that stop you from going in!!

data.title: Wonderful Charm
data.text: My friend and I were in town for a convention and needed to get away from business. We found this charming restaurant and had a wonderful meal. Chef Alex and his wife were both so personable. The food was outstanding and the atmosphere very relaxed. I'd go back again in a heartbeat.

data.title: SO much potential -
data.text:
Such a nice treat when you get inside this cozy little restaurant.  It has the feel of being in an actual restaurant in Rome including the Italian Owner to greet us at the door!

Soft lights, small wooden tables, friendly staff and the hum of laughter and conversation set an excellent beginning to your meal experience.  The home bread is warm when it reaches the table with a savory oil for dipping.  Nice selection of wine, home made sangria and drink list.  The menu is limited but offers a nice variety of options so it could satisfy all tastes at the table.

A chilled salad precedes the main course.  The portions are generous and presentation is inviting.  The actual meal, was bland.  As a group, we enjoyed the setting and the staff, the wine & bread/salad - in my opinion - the flavors of each dish needs to standout more.  To me - the flavors of Italian cooking - are something to experience and treasure - leaving me thinking about when I want to make another reservation to have my taste of Rome again.

data.title: Small restaurant with very good food
data.text: This restaurant does not look like much on the outside, but the food is very good and the prices are excellent.  I would say this is the type of place that you go for a good meal rather than  'dining experience'.  The house wine is Bolla so above average for a house wine.  make reservations as it only seats 50

data.title: Wonderful restaurant!
data.text: Went there for a late lunch. Absolutely the best bread (with dipping oil)  and salad I've ever had!!  And the pasta was delicious too!  The owner/chef took the time to visit with us too. Will definitely go back!

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text:
We have visited a few times and both the service and food is wonderful.

Frutti Di Mare is great with shrimp, scallops and squid - I wish they would use larger scallops as they become over-cooked by the hot pasta

Bolognese is basically spaghetti and meatballs - very tender and well liked by our group to keep ordering it.

The Luna Di Luna special is very good with chicken, shrimp, artichokes over cheese tortellini. The chicken could be a little crisper.

They change their menu about monthly. One appetizer and one dessert are offered; I hope that expands. A few more non-red sauce items would be welcome.

The owners work as cook and hostess with a waitstaff. Small place but everyone pitches in and it works well.

data.title: Shhhhh!!!! (Don't let the secret out!)
data.text: First time there.  Wonderful place, non chain, family owned and operated, only 50 seats.  Just a beer and wine license.  Nice small manageable menu w/ great selection of cooked to order pasta dishes with shrimp, chicken or scallops in wonderful sauce.  Speedy and friendly service, home cooked bread and a home made oil dip of 4 oils and 24 herbs and spices.  Simple and tasty salad.  We will definitely go back.  Go quickly before every one else finds it!  Just a few minutes from the Mall of America.

data.title: Fantastic Food
data.text: Great food, Great atmosphere, This place has only been open for 4 months but it is wonderful. Best Italian food since I was in Italy 2 years ago. Ordered a glass of the house Chianti and they brought along a saucer of fresh sliced Parmesan cheese to go with it. The bread is homemade and delicious. House salad comes with the meal and works well. Had a pasta dish with Italian sausage, meatballs served over penne pasta and cheese over the top managed to eat half and took the rest back to the hotel to enjoy later. Brought a piece of the Amaretto chocolate cake back and glad I did. If you're in the area don'rt miss this place! Salad, Bread, Wine, Huge dinner portion, dessert was $29.00.

user_location.name: Murrells Inlet, South Carolina, United States

data.title: Charming and delicious
data.text: Met a friend for dinner here during the week last week.  I love the atmosphere, small and cozy.  The wait staff was very friendly and attentive.  The bread was do die for - served with seasoned olive oil.  The menu is small, but everything looked great.  Not busy at all the weeknight we were there.  Prices are very reasonable.

data.title: Relaxing Meal or Celebration
data.text: I love Italian food, which meant my family often took me to Macaroni Grill for Birthdays. While their food was fine, I would say that much like Olive Garden it is a consistent chain experience with Americanized offerings. Luna di Luna is a quaint setting with attentive service and high quality food that is not mass produced. The menu is varied but small and the server will then offer a non-menu special. I have been once with my husband and son, once with just my son and most recently we took my daughter and her friend for her birthday celebration. They will happily wrap your leftovers (about half of my serving each time). The food has been excellent each visit! Perhaps the nicest surprise of all is when the bill comes, it has been consistently smaller than what we had been paying at chain franchises and rather than just a meal you feel as though you have had an experience. Probably not ideal for young kids because of the huge portions and more sophisticated offerings and more leisurely relaxed dining experience...while service is great, it's not intended to be a fast experience.

data.title: The very best
data.text: I have had Italian meals throughout the country. Although I have never been to Italy, I felt like I was the moment walking through the door. The food was so fresh and amazing. Gluten free pasta available. The cake it heavenly. Do not miss this quaint gem!

data.title: Fabulous Dinner
data.text: I can hardly wait to eat here again! The bread was delicious dipped in herb oil, sangria was outstanding, and the fresh pasta dishes magnificent. The atmosphere is friendly and the owner visits the table to make sure every need is met. My advice to you...go and find this hidden gem in Bloomington and treat yourself to one of the best Italian meals you'll ever have.

data.title: Fabulous Italian food
data.text:
My friend and I ate there for the first time today.  The bread (crusty on top ...soft in the middle...served hot with wonderful olive oil and herbs) came out first. I had the chicken and sausage with creamy tomato sauce over penne...to die for. My friend had the bolognese and it was great also!
Service was great...atmosphere was so fun!
Please go eat there...

data.title: Italian yummiest
data.text: Cozy setting, great food.  First course; lots of fresh bread and olive oil with spices.  Favorite; Quatro fromaggio with shrimp.  Dessert: only one option,  dark chocolate amaretto cake.  Who needs options!  They do have gluten-free noodles on request.

data.title: Cute little hideaway
data.text: It is great to have a small, quaint restaurant in our neighborhood.  The service was very friendly.  The bread and olive oil dip was amazing!  I could of eaten that as my meal.  The salad with homemade dressing was a very nice addition with the meal. Two people in our party had the Fettuccine Alfredo.  It was good but wasn't great.  It was a little bland for me.  My daughter had the Ceciliana and that was excellent.  Very flavorful.  I would go back and get that next time.  Very cute, very small restaurant.  Sangria was delicious!

data.title: What an awesome Bloomington gem!
data.text: My wife loves Italian and I wanted to take her somewhere special for her birthday. I gambled as I didn't know anything about this place. WOW, did it ever payoff! From the second we got out of our car we could smell fresh-baked bread and when we walked in, we got the feeling we were in for something special. All of the ingredients of our respective meals tasted as though they were gathered fresh that day (rooftop garden perhaps???), I know that's not the case, but it sure seems like it. The dining area is surprisingly spacious and I love the lack of TV screens. The background music (recorded) is at just the right level of volume to not be a distraction. Staff is incredibly friendly. I just cannot say enough about this place, hope it becomes a Bloomington staple.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: My husband and I had lunch here few weeks ago.  The food was great, both owners were pleasant.  We would come back definitely!

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: From the crusty bread and herbed olive oil to gulf shrimp and flavorful sauces this is a place to put on your regular list. We have! Thanks chef/owner, Alex, and partner, Sanaa.

data.title: A little gem in Bloomington
data.text: We were visiting the Twin Cities and based on the other reviews decided to try this place. Wonderful wonderful atmosphere and the food was great! My daughter singlehandedly ate all the bread! You could tell the food was made with care and from fresh ingredients. Staff was super friendly too.
